name: Ricky Dillard
description:
'''Ricky Rydell Dillard''' (born February 25, 1965) is an American gospel [[songwriter]], [[singer]], and [[choir director]]. He started his music career, in 1987, as a [[Chicago house]] musician. His first Christian music album was ''Promise'', by Muscle Shoals Records. His next album, ''A Holy Ghost Take-Over'', was released in 1993 by [[Malaco Records]]. The subsequent album, ''Hallelujah'', was released by them in 1995. Crystal Spring Records released, 1996's ''Work It Out'', 2000's ''No Limit'', and ''Unplugged'' in 2004. With [[Capitol Christian Music Group|EMI Gospel]], he released, ''7th Episode'', that came out in 2007. He released, ''Keep Living'', with [[Light Records]] in 2011. His next release, ''Amazing'', came out in 2014 with [[Entertainment One Music]].

All of his Christian albums charted on the [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] [[Top Gospel Albums|Gospel Albums]] chart. His ''No Limit'' album charted on the [[Christian Albums]] chart, and the album ''Unplugged'' charted on the [[Independent Albums]] chart along with the releases ''Keep Living'', and ''Amazing'' that also charted on [[Billboard 200|The ''Billboard'' 200]]. He was nominated at the [[Grammy Award]]s twice, the first time in the [[Grammy Award for Best Contemporary R&B Gospel Album|Best Contemporary R&B Gospel Album]] category at the [[34th Annual Grammy Awards]] for ''Promise'', and the second time would come at the [[57th Annual Grammy Awards]] in the category [[Grammy Award for Best Gospel Album|Best Gospel Album]] for ''Amazing''.
